bibl.author: George Washington Whitman
bibl.title: George Washington Whitman to Walt Whitman, 14 November 1875
bibl.orgName: Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p: Both of your postals recdreceived, I sent you a card on the 12th but as it was only directed Washington, I suppose itsit's doubtful if you recdreceived, it. Lou is getting along well, she is pretty weak yet, but is gaining all the time. Baby is growing nicely and seems as well as can be. There is several letters for you here, one from Burlington, & I think one from Jeff.
Edd, Tip, & myself are flourishing as usual.
body.note: on reverse is a letter from George (Whitman) a brother of Walt
